title: Oil prices ease as coronavirus infections rise

text: U.S. stock index futures rose late Monday, following gains on Wall Street after the Federal Reserve took additional action to keep credit flowing to big businesses amid the coronavirus pandemic.

text: The Federal Reserve on Monday launched its Main Street Lending Program, the most complex program undertaken yet by the U.S. central bank to help keep the backbone of the economy from buckling under the strains of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Stocks stage biggest turnaround in 3 months to end higher as Fed pledges to buy more corporate bonds
text: U.S. stock benchmarks shook off sharp opening losses Monday to stage the sharpest reversal since late March, with stocks closing higher after the Federal Reserve said it would expand an existing stimulus program to allow it to buy individual corporate bonds.

title: Wall Street closes higher as Fed soothes recovery worries
text: Wall Street closed higher on Monday following an announcement by the U.S. Federal Reserve regarding its corporate bond purchasing program that boosted investor confidence, which had been wavering amid a spike in new COVID-19 cases.

title: Federal Reserve Details $750 Billion in Corporate Bond Buying

title: Oil prices rise 2% on optimism around OPEC+ output pact
text: Oil prices rose more than 2% on Monday as signs that fuel demand was recovering, while OPEC+ members were complying with a production cut deal, outweighed fears that new coronavirus infections could further slow the global economy.

title: Stocks rebound on Fed debt program, oil recovers
text: A gauge of global equities rebounded on Monday after the Federal Reserve widened its program of buying corporate debt, while crude oil rebounded too on signs fuel demand is recovering and as investors grapple with how to assess the economic reopening.

title: FTSE 100 slides as China reports a resurge in COVID-19 cases
text: The UK blue-chip FTSE 100 index remained under pressure on Monday as China reported a significant increase in new COVID-19 cases again. The FTSE 100 opened at 6,105.18 but closed less than 1% down at 6,059.33 after posting a three-week low of 5,957.49 in the morning session.

title: NYSE to reopen trading floor to some market makers on Wednesday
text: The New York Stock Exchange will allow a limited number of market makers to return to its trading floor on Wednesday, a spokesperson said, nearly three months after closing it due to the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Fed to start buying individual corporate bonds, CNBC
text: The Federal Reserve will purchase corporate bonds to create a corporate bond portfolio.

title: Market Jumps After Federal Reserve Begins Buying Corporate Bonds For The First Time
text: After a sluggish start, markets jumped Monday afternoon after the Federal Reserve announced it will begin buying corporate bonds of individual companies.

title: Fed announces plans to buy broad basket of corporate bonds
text: The Federal Reserve said Monday it would buy a broad basket of corporate bonds from the secondary market through its emergency lending program, based on an index the central bank had created.

title: Oil futures end higher as signs of output declines outweigh energy demand concerns
text: Oil futures settled higher on Monday, buoyed by signs of continued declines in global production, even as a potential resurgence in global cases of COVID-19 fed concerns over energy demand.

title: Wall Street jumps on Fed's corporate bond purchase announcement
text: Wall Street jumped on Monday following an announcement by the U.S. Federal Reserve regarding its corporate bond purchasing program that boosted investor confidence, which had been wavering amid a spike in new COVID-19 cases.

title: Dow stages roughly 1,000-point swing to session high as Fed says it will buy individual corporate bonds
text: The stock market jumped to near session highs Monday afternoon after the Federal Reserve said that it is expanding its purchase of corporate credit to individual bonds, underscoring the central bank's willingness to support financial markets that have been reeling since the coronavirus-induced shock in March.

title: The Fed says it is going to start buying individual corporate bonds
text: Those purchases will go along with the ETFs the Fed already has been buying, the central bank announced Monday.

title: Gold futures mark a second straight session loss
text: Gold futures fell Monday for a second straight session, failing to find support from a weaker dollar and some losses in the U.S.

title: Wall Street mixed as investors weigh spike in virus cases
text: U.S. stocks were mixed in choppy afternoon trading on Monday, with the benchmark S&P 500 paring early losses to trade flat as investors weighed the economic outcome of a spike in new coronavirus cases in China and parts of the United States.

title: The stock market can't sit still. Why you should
text: If the pandemic has taught investors anything it's that they can't predict what's going to happen next to their portfolio. Their best bet is to hope that what's been true over the last century hasn't changed: over the long-term, stocks go up in value.
